title: UN Security Council unanimously condemns Taliban's treatment of women
description: The Council called on the Taliban to 'swiftly reverse the policies and practices that restrict the enjoyment by women and girls of their human rights and fundamental freedoms.'

title: Mike Pence testifies before grand jury investigating Trump's role in January 6 assault
description: Pence appeared before a grand jury in Washington that could be weighing whether to prosecute the ex-president and his advisors over the January 6, 2021 effort to forcibly block Joe Biden from becoming president.

title: Elephant seals, sleepless giants of the deep sea
description: American researchers have discovered that the pinniped sleeps two hours per night during its seven months at sea. It joins the African elephant at the top of the list of mammals that sleep the least.

title: Burkina Faso: Suspected jihadist attack kills 33 soldiers
description: Fighting between the security forces and groups linked to Al-Qaeda and the Islamic State group has left thousands dead and forced millions of people to flee their homes.

title: In Saint-Etienne, the extradition of mafia killer turned pizza chef
description: The Lyon Court of Appeal has requested the extradition of Edgardo Greco, a Calabrian mafia killer convicted in Italy, who has been on the run for 16 years.

title: Ethiopian PM says senior ruling party member murdered
description: A leader of the Prosperity Party in the region of Amhara was assassinated in an attack on April 27.

title: Colombia's Gustavo Petro makes a left turn with cabinet reshuffle
description: Faced with a stalled healthcare reform, the Colombian president has decided to reshape his government and end the coalition with the liberals and conservatives, weakening his parliamentary base.

title: Turkey: Three weeks from elections, Europe dreams of uncertain post-Erdogan era
description: Members of the European Union are starting to ponder the consequences of a possible defeat of the conservative leader, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, in the May 14 elections.

title: Spanish lawmakers approve historic housing law
description: On April 27, lawmakers approved Spain's first housing law since its return to democracy. It's part of an attempt to reduce soaring rental prices and unlock EU recovery funds.

title: In Tunisia, Ennahda's protracted downward spiral
description: The arrest of Rached Ghannouchi in mid-April was the culmination of a full-scale offensive unleashed by the Tunisian president against the Islamic-conservative party.

title: Azerbaijan accuses Paris of inaction over conflict in disputed region
description: France's foreign minister began a tour to Azerbaijan on Wednesday in attempts to calm tensions in the region.

title: Berlin appoints first conservative mayor in more than 20 years
description: Kai Wegner was sworn in after a secret ballot on April 27, but there are suspicions that his win was helped by support from a far-right party.

title: In Russia, lawyers are caught in the Kremlin's crosshairs
description: Political opponents and human rights defenders are heading into exile, after being surveilled, threatened and even prosecuted. A law now in preparation plans to further diminish their role.

title: 'In Mayotte, Comorians are not foreigners'
description: Ethnologist Sophie Blanchy explains the close ties between Mayotte and the Comoros, as Paris launches a vast operation to expel Comorian migrants from the former.

title: Jerry Springer, politician-turned-TV star, dies at 79
description: The former mayor of Cincinnati embraced a television career, and his 'Jerry Springer Show' became a hallmark of American entertainment.

title: El Al Israel Airlines boosted by Abraham Accords
description: The company is reaping the benefits of the peace treaty signed in 2020 between Israel, the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain, which also normalized relations with Morocco and Sudan.

title: 'The ‘Woke Disney’ feud is not just a power struggle, but also a culture war'
description: When Disney set up Disney World in Florida in 1967, it made a deal to have full power over the area. Now Republican Governor Ron DeSantis has broken that deal by replacing Disney execs on the district's board with his own men, as Le Monde columnist Philippe Escande explains.

title: War in Ukraine: Beijing presents itself as mediator
description: For the first time since the conflict began, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky spoke with his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping on Wednesday.

title: Singapore man hanged over 1 kilo of cannabis
description: The city-state stands by its policy of zero tolerance toward drugs and the use of the death penalty, in contrast to a region where sanctions are being relaxed.

title: Brazil bans Telegram in latest stage of troubled relationship with app
description: A Brazilian federal court ordered the app to be blocked for failing to sufficiently cooperate with an investigation into neo-Nazi groups. Widely used in Brazil, it had already been subject to a similar ban in 2022.

title: Finnish PM-designate to form coalition with far right
description: The far-right Finns party could be boosted into power through a coalition government with the conservative National Coalition party.

title: Record temperatures in Spain as heatwave peaks
description: The unusually early heatwave that has hit Spain should reach its peak on Thursday and Friday.

title: Sudan: Renewed army air strikes hit Khartoum on last day of truce
description: Fighting in Sudan erupted on April 15, with hundreds of people killed. More than 3,500 have fled to Ethiopia, said the UN.

title: French authorities demolish Indian Ocean island shanties
description: As part of the French government's operation to clear informal settlements and deport undocumented immigrants, authorities demolished shanties in the north of Mayotte.

title: PM Borne is already looking beyond Macron's 'hundred days'
description: The prime minister presented the government's new priorities, which are supposed to provide a sense of direction after the painful pension reform. The divisive bill on immigration was postponed.

title: French politicians the target of choice for Russian spies, says DGSI intelligence agency
description: The head of French counter-espionage, Nicolas Lerner, provided an overview of the current situation in before a parliamentary committee of inquiry on foreign interference.

title: US Republicans demand budget cuts as a condition for raising debt ceiling
description: The bill passed by the House of Representatives has no chance of being adopted in the Senate, where the Democrats have a majority. But the Republicans hope to force Joe Biden, who has been unwavering so far, to come to the negotiating table.

title: Engie shareholders demand more transparency on climate strategy
description: Investors rejected a proposition for greater transparency on Engie's environmental impact, but votes against the review were not as strong as expected – a good sign for future proposals.

title: Author accuses Donald Trump of rape before a New York court
description: E. Jean Carroll, a former women's magazine columnist, told a jury about her encounter with the former president nearly 30 years ago.

title: Peru declares state of emergency to block undocumented migrants at borders
description: Peru is trying to militarize its borders as Venezuelan migrants pour in from Chile.

title: Colombia's Petro replaces seven ministers in government reshuffle
description: The cabinet shakeup marks the most serious crisis to date within Petro's government.

title: French cinema upset by controversy over one director's methods
description: Catherine Corsini's new film 'Le Retour' was belatedly announced as part of the 76th Cannes Film Festival's official competition, in spite of allegations of abusive management and the shooting of a sex scene with an underage actor.

title: In Germany, the construction of the Northvolt battery factory is under threat from US subsidies
description: The Swedish battery developer is considering abandoning their plans to build a factory in northern Germany to instead build it in the United States where subsidies for decarbonized industrial projects are favorable.

title: The European Commission wants to make medicines more accessible and affordable
description: On Wednesday, the European Commission proposed a reform of community pharmaceutical legislation which includes reducing the period of exclusivity for major laboratories' patents from ten to eight years.

title: In Athens, solidarity with refugees has gradually faded
description: The new TV series 'Greek Salad' portrays a welcoming capital for migrants. This was the reality until four years ago, when the conservatives came to power.

title: Fugees rapper Pras Michel found guilty in illegal goverment lobbying scheme
description: Michel was accused of helping flamboyant Malaysian financier Low Taek Jho funnel money into then-president Barack Obama's 2012 re-election campaign via shell companies, hiding the donations' origins.

title: In Sweden, a young undocumented immigrant's charitable venture sparks an anti-racism campaign
description: In just a few days, 12-year-old Murhaf Hamid managed to raise more than three million kroner for a charity after being the target of hateful and openly racist comments.

title: 'The downward trend in productivity could herald a deep crisis of capitalism'
description: In his column for 'Le Monde,' economist Philippe Askenazy considers whether the decline in labor productivity in France is due to the 'laziness' of companies and their lack of innovation.
